Class PhysicsVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • PhysicsVector

  • public class PhysicsVector
extends java.lang.Object
    A 3-dimensional vector class to be used in the development of computer simulations of various physical systems. The 3-dimensional vector represents a standard Cartesian vector given by xi + yj +zk where i, j, and k are unit vectors in the x, y, and z directions respectively.
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Iain A. Bertram, Ian Bailey

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicsVector()
      Default constructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude
      PhysicsVector(double[] x)
      Constructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array.
      PhysicsVector(double x, double y)
      Constructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction and the second argument y giving the component in the j direction.
      PhysicsVector(double x, double y, double z)
      Constructor that takes three arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument giving the component in the i direction, the second argument giving the component in the j direction and the third argument giving the component in the k direction.
      PhysicsVector(PhysicsVector v)
      Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector()
        Default constructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double x,
                     double y)
        Constructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction and the second argument y giving the component in the j direction. The z component is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        x - x-component of the vector
        y - y-component of the vector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z)
        Constructor that takes three arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument giving the component in the i direction, the second argument giving the component in the j direction and the third argument giving the component in the k direction.
        Parameters:
        x - x-component of the vector
        y - y-component of the vector
        z - z-component of the vector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double[] x)
        Constructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array. If array length = 2 it sets only the x and y components. Returns a default vector if the array is not length 2 or 3 and prints a warning message. (NB It would be better to 'throw an exception' here if you know how to do it!)
        Parameters:
        x - array whose components will be transferred to the vector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(PhysicsVector v)
        Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be replicated

    • Method Detail

      • return2DString

        public java.lang.String return2DString()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector in 2D and has the form xi + yj.
        Returns:
        String with the form xi + yj

      • returnSimple2DString

        public java.lang.String returnSimple2DString()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector in 2D and has the form "x y"(I.e. coordinates separated by spaces).
        Returns:
        String with the form "x y"

      • returnString

        public java.lang.String returnString()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector in 3D and has the form xi + yj +zk.
        Returns:
        String with the form "xi + yj + zk"

      • returnSimpleString

        public java.lang.String returnSimpleString()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector in 3D and has the form "x y z" (I.e. coordinates separated by spaces).
        Returns:
        String "x y z"

      • print2D

        public void print2D()
        prints the 2D vector to 'standard out'. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: "xi + yj" for coordinates x and y.

      • print

        public void print()
        prints the 3D vector to 'standard out'. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: "xi + yj + zk" for coordinated x,y and z.

      • setVector

        public void setVector(double x,
                      double y,
                      double z)
        Change the value of the vector to xi + yj + zk
        Parameters:
        x - new x-component of the vector
        y - new y-component of the vector
        z - new z-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector(double x,
                      double y)
        Change the value of the vector to xi + yj. The z-component is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        x - new x-component of the vector
        y - new y-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector(PhysicsVector v)
        Modify the vector so that it is equal to vector v
        Parameters:
        v - the vector whose values are copied to this vector.

      • increaseBy

        public void increaseBy(PhysicsVector v)
        Add a vector v to this vector. Normal vector addition is carried out. I.e. the x-components are added and the y components are added, etc.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be added to original vector.

      • decreaseBy

        public void decreaseBy(PhysicsVector v)
        Subtract a vector v from the original vector. Normal vector subtraction is carried out. I.e. the x-components are subtracted and the y components are subtracted, etc.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be subtracted from the original vector.

      • magnitude

        public double magnitude()
        returns the magnitude of the vector. If the vector is given by xi +y<j +zk then the magnitude is sqrt(x^2 + y^2+ z^2).
        Returns:
        a scalar with the magnitude of the original vector.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Return the x-component of the vector
        Returns:
        x-component

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Return the y-component of the vector
        Returns:
        y-component

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Return the z-component of the vector
        Returns:
        z-component

      • getUnitVector

        public PhysicsVector getUnitVector()
        Returns a vector with a magnitude of 1 and the original direction of this vector. I.e. scale the vector by 1/magnitude. If the vector is a zero vector then it returns the zero length vector.
        Returns:
        unit vector with the same direction of the original vector

      • scale

        public void scale(double x)
        Scale the components of the vector by a scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s and the vector is xi<\b>+yj<\b>+zk<\b> then the vector transforms to xsi<\b>+ysj<\b>+zsk<\b>
        Parameters:
        x - the factor to scale the vector by.

      • scale

        public static PhysicsVector scale(double x,
                                  PhysicsVector v)
        Scale the components of the vector by a scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s then the vector xi<\b>+yj<\b>+zk<\b> transfoms to xsi<\b>+ysj<\b>+zsk<\b>
        Parameters:
        x - the factor to scale the vector by.
        v - the vector to scale.
        Returns:
        a vector equal to the scaled original vector

      • dot

        public static double dot(PhysicsVector u,
                         PhysicsVector v)
        Standard vector scalar product. If xi<\b>+yj<\b>+zk<\b> and ri<\b>+sj<\b>+tk<\b> then the dot product returns xr+ys+zt
        Parameters:
        u - first vector in product
        v - second vector in product
        Returns:
        the scalar product between u and v

      • vectorProduct

        public static PhysicsVector vectorProduct(PhysicsVector u,
                                          PhysicsVector v)
        Standard vector (cross) product between two 3D vectors: u and v. The result is a vector which is perpendicular to the original vectors with a magnitude equal to |u||v|Sin(t) where 't' is the angle between the vectors.
        Parameters:
        u - first vector
        v - second vector
        Returns:
        the vector product of u and v

      • add

        public static PhysicsVector add(PhysicsVector u,
                                PhysicsVector v)
        Standard vector addition. If the two vectors are xi<\b>+yj<\b>+zk<\b> and ri<\b>+sj<\b>+tk<\b>, then the method returns a vector (x+r)i<\b>+(y+s)j<\b>+(z+t)k<\b>
        Parameters:
        u - first vector in sum
        v - second vector in sum
        Returns:
        summed vector

      • subtract

        public static PhysicsVector subtract(PhysicsVector u,
                                     PhysicsVector v)
        Vector subtraction. If the two vectors are xi<\b>+yj<\b>+zk<\b> and ri<\b>+sj<\b>+tk<\b> respectively then the method returns a vector (x-r)i<\b>+(y-s)j<\b>+(z-t)k<\b>
        Parameters:
        u - first vector in sum
        v - second vector in sum
        Returns:
        resultant vector
